title: Emergency Snakebite Treatment Protocol
brief: Step-by-step treatment for poisonous snakebites in survival situations.
steps: Reassure victim and keep them still to slow circulation.
Set up for shock treatment and force fluids or give IV.
Remove watches, rings, bracelets, or other constricting items.
Maintain airway and be prepared for mouth-to-mouth resuscitation.
Use constricting band between wound and heart.
If medical treatment over 1 hour away: make incision 6mm long, 3mm deep over each puncture.
Use suction cup 3-4 times, or mouth suction as last resort if no mouth sores.
Apply heat after 24-48 hours to prevent local infection spread.
warnings: Do not give alcohol, tobacco, or CNS depressants
Do not make deep cuts - opens direct route for venom into bloodstream
If using mouth suction, spit out blood and rinse mouth with water
Do not put hands on face or rub eyes after handling venom
Do not break open large blisters around bite site
